uiEntry.title: region_name
uiEntry.tooltip: Currently selected region.||Use the arrows to the left and right to switch to your next region's details.

uiEntry.title: arrow L
uiEntry.tooltip: Previous region
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("region_info"))
function OnMouseLClickUp() parent:LuaCall("PreviousRegion") end

uiEntry.title: arrow R
uiEntry.tooltip: Next region
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("region_info"))
function OnMouseLClickUp() parent:LuaCall("NextRegion") end

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: This section shows the public order details for the different sections of your populace.||Keeping public order is essential to running a successful prosperous region.||This is influenced by both the population's happiness and the government's level of control over the region.||The ruling and lower classes have different levels of public order - if either class becomes unruly it can escalate into rebellion or even revolution.||Move your cursor over the icons below to see the positive and negative effects on the ruling and lower classes.

uiEntry.title: positive_bar
uiEntry.tooltip: Positive influences||A cultured region is a happy region.||Opera houses and theatres will keep the elite amused.||Improving government control through garrisons will curb some of their more decadent tendencies and help keep order.

uiEntry.title: negative_bar
uiEntry.tooltip: Negative influences||If the ruling class become too unhappy, public order will break down resulting in riots and revolts.||High taxes will vex the ruling classes and cause them to raise their voices in disgust.||Lowering taxes will improve their moods and stop any trouble from being stirred up.

uiEntry.title: plus
uiEntry.tooltip: Positive influences||A cultured region is a happy region.||Opera houses and theatres will keep the elite amused.||Improving government control through garrisons will curb some of their more decadent tendencies and help keep order.

uiEntry.title: minus
uiEntry.tooltip: Negative influences||If the ruling class become too unhappy, public order will break down resulting in riots and revolts.||High taxes will vex the higher classes and cause them to raise their voices in disgust.||Lowering taxes will improve their moods and stop any trouble from being stirred up.

state.title: Neutral
state.tooltip: Ruling class: Indifferent||Your ruling class are currently neither angry nor happy.||Applying a little extra repression will improve their public order.||This is based on the positive and negative factors to the right.

state.title: Happy
state.tooltip: Ruling class: Under control||Your ruling class are currently under control.||This is based on the positive and negative factors to the right.

state.title: Angry
state.tooltip: Ruling class: Angry||Your ruling class are angry and are likely to cause trouble!||Try to placate the protesting populace by exempting the region from tax or increasing repression!||This is based on the positive and negative factors to the right.

uiEntry.title: total
uiEntry.tooltip: Total ruling class public order||This is based on the positive and negative factors to the right.||Mouse over the icon to the left to see the public order status for this class.

uiEntry.title: positive_bar
uiEntry.tooltip: Positive influences||Build government buildings such as a parliament and keep the town well garrisoned to provide a strong guiding hand to help protect the rabble from themselves.||Your lower classes can't work on an empty stomach - develop your agriculture to provide food and work and improve public order.

uiEntry.title: negative_bar
uiEntry.tooltip: Negative influences||If the lower classes become too unhappy, public order will break down, resulting in riots and revolts.||The lower classes are not particularly well off, and taxes add another burden for them to bear.||Reduce that burden by lowering the lower class tax rate and lessen the likelihood of transforming them into an angry mob!

uiEntry.title: plus
uiEntry.tooltip: Positive influences||Build government buildings such as a parliament and keep the town well garrisoned to provide a strong guiding hand to help protect the rabble from themselves.||Your lower classes can't work on an empty stomach - develop your agriculture to provide food and work and improve public order.

uiEntry.title: minus
uiEntry.tooltip: Negative influences||If the lower classes become too unhappy, public order will break down, resulting in riots and revolts.||The lowest class are not particularly well off, and taxes add another burden for them to bear.||Reduce that burden by lowering the lowest class tax rate and lessen the likelihood of transforming them into an angry mob!

state.title: Neutral
state.tooltip: Lower class: Indifferent||Your lower classes are currently neither angry nor happy.||They could go either way at the moment - improving repression a little will improve their public order.||This is based on the factors to the right.

state.title: Happy
state.tooltip: Lower class: Under control||Your lower class are currently under control.||They are either very happy, very repressed or a little of both!||This is based on the factors to the right.

state.title: Angry
state.tooltip: Lower class: Angry||Your lower classes are currently angry and likely to riot.||Try increasing repression or exempting this region from tax to prevent rioting!||This is based on the factors to the right.

uiEntry.title: total
uiEntry.tooltip: Total lower class public order||This is based on the positive and negative factors to the right.||Mouse over the icon to the left to see the public order status for this class.

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: This section shows the details of this region's wealth.||These details will help to show you how to improve region wealth.

uiEntry.title: positive_bar
uiEntry.tooltip: This displays all the factors that contribute to the generation of wealth in this region.||Industry and agriculture are important in advancing your region wealth.||Build farms, ports and workshops to increase these aspects of your region.||Move your cursor over the icons to display more information.

uiEntry.title: total
uiEntry.tooltip: Total region wealth||This is the sum of all the factors that are contributing to the wealth of this region.||This value will increase each turn by the total growth shown below-left.

uiEntry.title: total
uiEntry.tooltip: Total growth this turn||This is the amount that your total region wealth will increase next turn.||This number is the result of the negative and positive factors to the left.||Move your cursor over the icons to the left for more information.

uiEntry.title: positive_bar
uiEntry.tooltip: Positive growth||The factors affecting the rate at which your region wealth will grow per turn.||Move your cursor over the icons to see what is helping growth.

uiEntry.title: negative_bar
uiEntry.tooltip: Negative growth||The factors affecting the rate at which your region wealth will grow per turn.||Move your cursor over the icons to see what is hindering growth.

uiEntry.title: copy of plus
uiEntry.tooltip: Positive growth||The factors affecting the rate at which your region wealth will grow per turn.||Move your cursor over the icons to see what is helping growth.

uiEntry.title: minus
uiEntry.tooltip: Negative growth||The factors affecting the rate at which your region wealth will grow per turn.||Move your cursor over the icons to see what is hindering growth.

uiEntry.title: treasury_icon
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("region_info"))
function OnMouseOn() parent:LuaCall("OnMouseOnTaxIncome") end
function OnMouseOff() parent:LuaCall("OnMouseOffTaxIncome") end

uiEntry.title: taxes_checkbox
uiEntry.tooltip: Exempting a region from tax will be a massive boost to your population's happiness.||This is an effective way of dealing with an unruly region, and could stop any riots that have started or may be brewing.||Freeing this region from the burden of taxes will also help population growth within the region.
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("region_info"))
function OnSelected() parent:LuaCall("Notify", Component.Messages.StateChange, Component.Call("CurrentState"), Address) end

uiEntry.title: Exempt region..
uiEntry.tooltip: Exempting a region from tax will be a massive boost to your population's happiness.||This is an effective way of dealing with an unruly region, and could stop any riots that have started or may be brewing.||Freeing this region from the burden of taxes will also help economic growth within the region.

uiEntry.title: button_taxes
uiEntry.tooltip: Sets tax rate across all your regions.||Selecting this will bring up the Government panel policies tab.
uiEntry.script:
dofile "data/ui/templates/template.fe_button_standard.lua"
local root = UIComponent(Component.Root())
function OnSelect() root:LuaCall("OpenTaxes") end

uiEntry.title: dy_tax_percent
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("region_info"))
function OnMouseOn() parent:LuaCall("OnMouseOnTaxIncome") end
function OnMouseOff() parent:LuaCall("OnMouseOffTaxIncome") end

uiEntry.title: treasury_text
uiEntry.tooltip: Total treasury income||The amount that this region contributes to your funds every year.||It is calculated using your region wealth and your total tax rate.||Increase this number by raising taxes or increasing region wealth.

uiEntry.title: Population panel layout
uiEntry.parentName: copy of Public order panel layout

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: This section provides details on the population of this region.||You should aim to increase the population in a region as much as possible.||It is also beneficial to encourage your population to be the same religion as your nation.||Move your cursor over the different areas below for more details.

uiEntry.title: total
uiEntry.tooltip: Total population growth rate||This is based on the preceding positive and negative influences.||This region's total population will increase by this percentage every turn.

uiEntry.title: positive_bar
uiEntry.tooltip: Positive population growth||The most important influence for a healthy population growth is farming.||Constructing fishing ports will also have a positive effect.

uiEntry.title: negative_bar
uiEntry.tooltip: Negative population growth

uiEntry.title: pop_growth_heading
uiEntry.tooltip: The icons below show the positive and negative influences that affect the growth of your population.||If the positive influences outweigh the negative ones, your population will increase.||Mouse over individual influence icons to find out more about them.

uiEntry.title: copy of plus
uiEntry.tooltip: Positive population growth||The most important influence for a healthy population growth is farming.||Constructing fishing ports will also have a positive effect.

uiEntry.title: minus
uiEntry.tooltip: Negative population growth

state.title: no_villages
state.tooltip: All villages have already appeared in this region.||You may want to increase the population in other regions where there are still villages to develop.

state.title: negative_growth
state.tooltip: You need to increase population growth.||Move your cursor over the positive and negative factors above to see how you can help population growth.

uiEntry.title: dy_Population
uiEntry.tooltip: Population||This is the current total population of this region.||The section to the left shows the influences on population growth.

uiEntry.title: pip_pop
uiEntry.tooltip: Population||This is the current total population of this region.||The section to the left shows the influences on population growth.

state.title: rel_nonconformist
state.tooltip: Nonconformist||You will have more public order with populations that follow your national religion.||You can use your missionaries to start converting a region by moving them into that area.

state.title: rel_animist
state.tooltip: Animist||You will have more public order with populations that follow your national religion.||You can use your missionaries to start converting a region by moving them into that area.

state.title: rel_catholic
state.tooltip: Catholic||You will have more public order with populations that follow your national religion.||You can use your missionaries to start converting a region by moving them into that area.

state.tooltip: Hindu||You will have more public order with populations that follow your national religion.||You can use your missionaries to start converting a region by moving them into that area

state.tooltip: Orthodox||You will have more public order with populations that follow your national religion.||You can use your missionaries to start converting a region by moving them into that area.

state.title: rel_protestant
state.tooltip: Protestant||You will have more public order with populations that follow your national religion.||You can use your missionaries to start converting a region by moving them into that area.

state.title: rel_sikh
state.tooltip: Sikh||You will have more public order with populations that follow your national religion.||You can use your missionaries to start converting a region by moving them into that area.

state.title: rel_buddhist
state.tooltip: Buddhist||You will have more public order with populations that follow your national religion.||You can use your missionaries to start converting a region by moving them into that area.

state.title: rel_islamic
state.tooltip: Islamic||You will have more public order with populations that follow your national religion.||You can use your missionaries to start converting a region by moving them into that area.

uiEntry.title: percentage
uiEntry.tooltip: You will have more public order with populations that follow your national religion.||You can use your missionaries to start converting a region by moving them into that area.

uiEntry.title: button_close
uiEntry.tooltip: Close this panel
